intro: Vernonanthura auriculata, commonly known as the auriculate vernonberry, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its small, leathery leaves and clusters of pink or white blooms make it a distinctive addition to native plant gardens. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to local wildlife.
